p: Limonene has been reported to be the major chemical constituent present in lemon EOs. Shakir et al. reported [ 37] concentrations of limonene of 65.2867 wt.% and 59.156 wt.% in the EO obtained from lemon (Citrus limon) peels by HD and MAHD, respectively, in accordance with our results (65.082 wt.%) but using longer extraction times. Yazgan et al. [ 38] found a similar limonene concentration of 52.85 wt.% in lemon ( Citrus limonum) plant EOs by HD using an industrial type of Clavenger device for four h. Dao et al. [ 36] reported α-citral as the main component found in EO from lemon ( Citrus aurantifolia L.) leaves by MAHD, reaching a content of 27.982 wt.%, followed by β-citronellol and D-limonene at 20.06 wt.% and 15.732 wt.%, respectively.
